entry.title: Register Now for Alumni Reunion Weekend!
entry.summary: A note from Rodney Ekstrom ’09G, Director of Alumni Relations   Alumni Reunion Weekend is a chance to reconnect with your classmates and get back in touch with a community that, for all the reasons that make our lives busy, you may not have seen in many years.   There’s a lot of be proud of [...]
entry.content:
A note from Rodney Ekstrom ’09G, Director of Alumni Relations

 

Alumni Reunion Weekend is a chance to reconnect with your classmates and get back in touch with a community that, for all the reasons that make our lives busy, you may not have seen in many years.

 

There’s a lot of be proud of at Plymouth State. Academic programs have expanded to include diverse options at the undergraduate and graduate level; new academic,athletic, and residential facilities have attracted new students, faculty, and staff; and students continue to embody our motto, Ut prosim, through thousands of hours committed to serving the Plymouth State and greater community.

 

What else can we be proud of? An alumni community of more than 30,000 people who are giving back to their own communities and professions, and in various ways, to their alma mater.

 

At Alumni Reunion Weekend, we celebrate relationships, both existing and new, and all the things you value about your time on campus. Make plans to join us June 20-22, 2014, where we’ll honor landmark class reunions and the mark the 3rd biennial Greek Alumni Reunion. The campus will be yours once again, you’ll hear stories you haven’t heard in years, and make more memories of your own…until the next reunion!

entry.title: Law and Creative Arts Conference at PSU
entry.summary: PSU’s College of Arts and Sciences and the Office of Research and Engagement invite alumni and friends to a law and the creative arts conference on May 30, 2014. Network with artists across the state, re-connect with friends and mentors from PSU, meet current students, and participate in a dynamic day together. Protecting the Creative [...]
entry.content:
PSU’s College of Arts and Sciences and the Office of Research and Engagement invite alumni and friends to a law and the creative arts conference on May 30, 2014. Network with artists across the state, re-connect with friends and mentors from PSU, meet current students, and participate in a dynamic day together.
Protecting the Creative Spirit:
Copyright, Intellectual Property Law, and the Creative Arts
8:30 a.m.-3:45 p.m.  Newfound Room, Prospect Dining Hall
$50 per person, includes breakfast and lunch
Register today
A series of interactive panels will address the needs and interests of creative artists regarding intellectual property rights, copyright, contracting, commissions, and provenance. Panelists include legal specialists Drs. Kate and Peter McGovern, Susan Richy, Sarah Chafey, and Amanda Nelson; musicians Romeo Melloni and Paul Warnick; and PSU faculty Thaddeus Guldbrandsen and Rick St. Hilaire.

For additional information, please contact Jen Cerami, Office of the Academic Deans, (603) 535-3500.

entry.title: Open House for Prospective Juniors
entry.summary: Do you have (or know) a high school junior who’s considering Plymouth State? The Undergraduate Admissions Office is hosting a special visiting opportunity on Saturday, April 26 from 9-11:30 a.m. at Silver Center for the Arts for juniors who want to jump-start their college search. Come and learn more about PSU’s academic program offerings and take a campus tour. Free parking [...]
entry.content:
Do you have (or know) a high school junior who’s considering Plymouth State?
The Undergraduate Admissions Office is hosting a special visiting opportunity on Saturday, April 26 from 9-11:30 a.m. at Silver Center for the Arts for juniors who want to jump-start their college search.

Come and learn more about PSU’s academic program offerings and take a campus tour. Free parking is available at the Ice Arena and Savage Welcome Center and the shuttles will take guests to the Silver Center.

Let us know you’re coming or register at the door. We look forward to welcoming you!

entry.title: 2014 Alumni Recognition Awards Nominations
entry.summary: We need your help to identify outstanding alumni who should be recognized for their accomplishments, achievements, and contributions to their communities and professions, and to PSU. Categories include: Alumni Achievement Award Distinguished Alumni Service Award Faculty/Staff Award of Excellence Graduating Senior Award of Excellence Outstanding Graduate Alumni Award Recent Alumni Award of Excellence Ut Prosim Award There’s [...]
entry.content:
We need your help to identify outstanding alumni who should be recognized for their accomplishments, achievements, and contributions to their communities and professions, and to PSU.

Categories include:

  • Alumni Achievement Award
  • Distinguished Alumni Service Award
  • Faculty/Staff Award of Excellence
  • Graduating Senior Award of Excellence
  • Outstanding Graduate Alumni Award
  • Recent Alumni Award of Excellence
  • Ut Prosim Award

There’s no limit to the number of nominations; however, all nominations must be received by June 30, 2014.

entry.title: Boston Business Forum
entry.summary: More than 65 Plymouth State alumni and current students gathered at Atlantic Wharf on March 6 for the Boston Business Forum (BBF). Guests networked with other Boston-area alumni and enjoyed a wine tasting from 90+ Cellars. John Troy ’82, an early investor in the company, and 90+ President Kevin Mahar spoke about the business and [...]
entry.content:
More than 65 Plymouth State alumni and current students gathered at Atlantic Wharf on March 6 for the Boston Business Forum (BBF). Guests networked with other Boston-area alumni and enjoyed a wine tasting from 90+ Cellars. John Troy ’82, an early investor in the company, and 90+ President Kevin Mahar spoke about the business and its explosive growth. Professor of Business Bob Nadeau ’07G shared news about PSU’s nationally ranked Professional Sales Leadership program.Check out photos from the evening!

Did you miss out on this event? Join the PSU Alumni Business Network LinkedIn group to make sure you receive invites to future BBF gatherings.

entry.title: 3rd Biennial Greek Alumni Reunion
entry.summary: Save the date for the 3rd biennial Greek Alumni Reunion on June 20-22, 2014! The weekend includes campus tours, tubing the Pemi, commemorative t-shirts, an all-Greek photo on the steps of Mary Lyon, and the Saturday night gathering featuring DJ Chuck Noel ’78! Mark your calendar and be a part of the tradition. Online registration opens on Tuesday, [...]
entry.content:
Save the date for the 3rd biennial Greek Alumni Reunion on June 20-22, 2014!
The weekend includes campus tours, tubing the Pemi, commemorative t-shirts, an all-Greek photo on the steps of Mary Lyon, and the Saturday night gathering featuring DJ Chuck Noel ’78!

Mark your calendar and be a part of the tradition. Online registration opens on Tuesday, April 15.

entry.title: AMC Weekend Recap
entry.summary: Plymouth State’s first adventure weekend with the AMC was a great success. Alumni gathered at the Joe Dodge Lodge at Pinkham Notch for a weekend of snowshoeing, cross-country skiing, and great food. Lunch break with new friends A late summer/fall trip in the White Mountains is in the works for you warm-weather adventure seekers. Want ‘first dibs’ on signing [...]
entry.content:
Plymouth State’s first adventure weekend with the AMC was a great success. Alumni gathered at the Joe Dodge Lodge at Pinkham Notch for a weekend of snowshoeing, cross-country skiing, and great food.
Lunch break with new friends

A late summer/fall trip in the White Mountains is in the works for you warm-weather adventure seekers.

Want ‘first dibs’ on signing up? 
Drop us a line at alumni@plymouth.edu.

entry.title: 2014 Alumni Recognition Awards
entry.summary: Do you know an alumna or alumnus who is making significant contributions to his or her community, profession, or the University? Is there a Plymouth State faculty or staff member who is engaged with the alumni community and deserving of recognition? Nominations for the 2014 Alumni Recognition Awards are now being accepted. Please take a moment to nominate someone whose [...]
entry.content:
Click here to view the embedded video.

Do you know an alumna or alumnus who is making significant contributions to his or her community, profession, or the University?

Is there a Plymouth State faculty or staff member who is engaged with the alumni community and deserving of recognition?

Nominations for the 2014 Alumni Recognition Awards are now being accepted. Please take a moment to nominate someone whose accomplishments and contributions benefit society and the University community, who inspires others to be their best, and who embodies the University’s commitment to excellence and service. The awards will be presented at the Celebrating Excellence Dinner held on Saturday, September 27, 2014, during Homecoming & Family Celebration. Submit a nomination today!

entry.title: PSU Pet Therapy
entry.summary: By Keith Bouchard ’14 Starting college is one of the most exciting and unnerving experiences that most young adults have gone through this early in life. It challenges them, helps them grow, and teaches them new things everyday. When students leave home for the first time, however, they may miss things they never expected. Home-cooked [...]
entry.content:
Click here to view the embedded video.

By Keith Bouchard ’14

Starting college is one of the most exciting and unnerving experiences that most young adults have gone through this early in life. It challenges them, helps them grow, and teaches them new things everyday. When students leave home for the first time, however, they may miss things they never expected. Home-cooked meals, their old bedrooms, and for those who have them, their dogs.

In spring 2013, Plymouth State University launched a pet therapy program which aims to satisfy every student’s canine craving. The first session was held during finals week 2013, normally a high-stress period of the year.

“I’d wanted to do this for a long time,” says Wendy Hills ’04G, the PSU Wellness Center coordinator. Pet safety was originally a concern, but all dogs require K-9 certification from the nation’s leading dog school, which focuses on behavior modification and trainer education. “[The program] was a huge success,” says Hills. “Students loved it. Some stayed for a whole hour and they couldn’t stop smiling.”

All of the K-9 certified dogs used in the program are local to the Plymouth area. Some belong to alumni, like Kathleen Norris ’98CAGS and Laura Brusseau ’04, and to faculty members like Ann Berry.

Some people may wonder why spending time with dogs makes such a difference when it comes to stress reduction. Many psychologists have noted the benefits of pet interaction, which they claim reduces anxiety and boosts productivity. Even the simple act of petting a dog is described as inherently therapeutic.

As for herself, Hills has a few other reasons for believing in the benefits of the program. “It’s truly a bonding experience–an animal does not judge.”

Additional sessions in residence halls will be offered this spring. Each session features several dogs that switch on and off for breaks. “We want to give the dogs what they need, too,” said Hills.

To learn more, visit the Wellness Center’s Facebook page or call (603) 535-2853.
